law.catch_line: In the administration of this title, the Secretary shall cooperate with the United States Secretary ...

section.section: In the administration of this title, the Secretary shall cooperate with the United States Secretary of Labor to the fullest extent that this title allows.

The Secretary shall:
make each report in the form and containing the information that the Secretary of Labor requires;
comply with each provision that the Secretary of Labor considers necessary to ensure the accuracy of a report; and
comply with each regulation that the Secretary of Labor adopts to govern the expenditure of any money that may be allotted and paid to the State under Chapter 7, Subchapter III of the Social Security Act to assist in the administration of this title.
The Secretary may afford reasonable cooperation with each federal unit that administers an unemployment insurance law.

On request, the Secretary shall provide to a federal unit that administers public works or assistance through public employment:
the name, address, usual occupation, and employment status of each recipient of benefits; and
information about the right of the individual to receive benefits.

text.section:
The Secretary:
may make available to the Railroad Retirement Board any record of the State that relates to administration of this title; and
at the expense of the Railroad Retirement Board, may provide to the Board a copy of any record that the Board considers necessary for its purposes.
